content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
C++ ctime Functions
The
<ctime>
library has a variety of functions that allow you to measure dates and times.
Function
Description
asctime()
Returns a C-style string representation of the time in a
tm
structure
clock()
Returns a number representing the amount of time that has passed while the program is running
ctime()
Returns a C-style string representation of the time in a timestamp
difftime()
Returns the time difference between two timestamps
gmtime()
Converts a timestamp into a
tm
structure representing its time at the GMT time zone
localtime()
Converts a timestamp into a
tm
structure representing its time in the system's local time zone
mktime()
Converts a
tm
structure into a timestamp
strftime()
Writes a C-style string representing the date and time of a
tm
structure with a variety of formatting options
time()
Returns a timestamp representing the current moment in time
